labels.analysis: The MCP Server provides real-time cryptocurrency data through interactions with the CoinGecko API. Its primary functionality revolves around retrieving current prices, market trends, and detailed information about various cryptocurrencies. The available tools allow users to access specific data points, ensure the latest market information, and monitor trending coins, making it valuable for applications that require up-to-date cryptocurrency insights.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Cryptocurrency & Blockchain" was chosen because the server's core functionality is centered around accessing real-time cryptocurrency data. The secondary labels "API Integration" and "Data Analysis & Processing" were added because the server leverages an API to provide structured financial data that can be used for analysis or application enhancements. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories adequately cover the server's functionality.

tools.name: coingecko_price
tools.description: Get current price data for cryptocurrencies

ids.description: List of coin IDs (e.g., bitcoin, ethereum, etc.)

vs_currencies.description: List of currencies to compare against (e.g., usd, eur, etc.)

tools.name: coingecko_list
tools.description: Get list of all supported coins with ids, names, and symbols

include_platform.description: Include platform contract addresses (e.g., for tokens on Ethereum)

tools.name: coingecko_coin_data
tools.description: Get current data for a coin (price, market, volume, etc.)

vs_currencies.description: List of currencies to get price data in (e.g., usd, eur, etc.)

tools.name: coingecko_trending
tools.description: Get trending coins on CoinGecko in the last 24 hours

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@Hott-J/coingecko-mcp-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
